security: This manuscript describes the CIA operation in detail with meetings, conversations, and internal and external CIA actions reported extensively. It reveals the identities and roles of CIA personnel involved in the Bay of Pigs operation, potentially compromising their security and revealing sensitive operational methods.
summary: A memorandum evaluating Edward J. Hamilton's manuscript, "Give Us This Day; CIA and the Bay of Pigs Invasion," which details CIA's role in the Bay of Pigs invasion from an insider's perspective and criticizes certain figures in the Kennedy Administration.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET memorandum, dated February 16, 1970, assesses Edward J. Hamilton's manuscript about the Bay of Pigs invasion, noting it has been circulating without CIA clearance. The manuscript, written from Hamilton’s perspective as a CIA participant, provides a detailed account of the operation, favorable to CIA but critical of Kennedy Administration figures. The memo highlights concerns about security breaches due to the extensive details of CIA actions and personnel, including the potential identification of individuals involved and the revealing of operational methods. The memorandum includes a chapter-by-chapter description of the manuscript, particularly regarding its impact on CIA security.
title: Comments on Manuscript Give Us This Day; CIA and the Bay of Pigs Invasion by Edward J. Hamilton
sender: Walter Plorsheimer, Curator, Historical Intelligence Collection
